alert.note: Alert for Gadsden; Jackson (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 6:29PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Jackson, northwestern Gadsden, southwestern Decatur and central Seminole Counties through 715 PM EDT/615 PM CDT/... At 628 PM EDT/528 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Chattahoochee, or 15 miles east of Marianna. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Marianna, Greensboro, Chattahoochee, Malone, Sneads, Grand Ridge, Greenwood, Bascom, Juniper, Rosedale, Blue Spring, Union City, Lovedale, Jinks, Dellwood, Riverturn, Star, Hornsville, Alliance and Buena Vista. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
